alert.note: Alert for Chase; Hayes; Perkins (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 11 at 7:01PM CDT until May 11 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MDT/945 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING FOR CHASE, SOUTHWESTERN HAYES AND WESTERN PERKINS COUNTIES... At 601 PM MDT /701 PM CDT/, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain and flooding occurring along highway 6 between Imperial and Enders Reservoir. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Although the rainfall has decreased, flash flooding has been reported and may still be occurring.. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Imperial, Grant, Wauneta, Champion, Enders Reservoir State Recreation Area, Enders, Chase, Hamlet, Wanamaker State Wildfire Management Area, Church Grove Campground, Center Dam Campground, Area A Campground, Wild Horse Spring and Brandon. This includes the following highways... Highway 61 between mile markers 25 and 76. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
